oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Letter to his family dated Nov. 26, 1967, begins, "At 9:30 this morning seven of us hopped aboard the truck to take us to the outer edge of the perimeter. We were going for a 3 click (3,000 meters) patrol outside the camp." On his first patrol he found propoganda leaflets in a cleared area, rice paddies, water buffaloes, children asking for cigarettes, and pot growing in a field. He ends as follows: "All the days are the same no Sat. or Sundays, it just seems like the same day over and over again."

oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Christopher D. Ammons was born in Norfolk, Virginia in 1948. He enlisted in the Army on June 1, 1967, and served with the 1st Infantry Division and later with the 194th Military Police Company. He served two tours in Vietnam, 1967-1968 and 1969-1970.
